summary: The document, declassified under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, explores the connections of two individuals, Evelio Duque Miyar (alias Luis Martin Hernandez) and Herminio Diaz Garcia, to anti-Castro activities and narcotics trafficking. It details their roles, affiliations, and the Cuban government's interest in them, highlighting Duque's leadership in anti-Castro forces and Diaz's involvement in narcotics smuggling and attempts to infiltrate Cuba.
key_findings: Evelio Duque Miyar was a commander of anti-Castro forces and had been a member of the '13th of March Revolutionary Directorate' during the struggle against the Batista regime.
Herminio Diaz Garcia was reported to be smuggling narcotics between Mexico and the U.S., and was also involved with the 38th November Movement, attempting to infiltrate Cuba in 1966.
The document suggests a possible connection between Diaz and Sandalio Hermino Diaz Garcia, who was reported killed during an attempt to invade Cuba in 1966.
Duque was accused by Orlando Bosch Avila of misappropriating funds meant for warlike activities against Cuba, using them instead for personal pleasures.
keywords: John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
